entries.source: Git is not ready. When all settings are correct you can configure commit-sync, etc.
entries.translated: Git is not ready. When all settings are correct you can configure commit-sync, etc.

entries.source: Show the author of the commit in the history view.
entries.translated: Show the author of the commit in the history view.

entries.source: Show the date of the commit in the history view. The {{date}} placeholder format is used to display the date.
entries.translated: Show the date of the commit in the history view. The {{date}} placeholder format is used to display the date.

entries.source: Automatically refresh source control view on file changes
entries.translated: Automatically refresh source control view on file changes

entries.source: On slower machines this may cause lags. If so, just disable this option.
entries.translated: On slower machines this may cause lags. If so, just disable this option.

entries.source: Milliseconds to wait after file change before refreshing the Source Control View.
entries.translated: Milliseconds to wait after file change before refreshing the Source Control View.

entries.source: Set the style for the diff view. Note that the actual diff in "Split" mode is not generated by Git, but the editor itself instead so it may differ from the diff generated by Git. One advantage of this is that you can edit the text in that view.
entries.translated: Set the style for the diff view. Note that the actual diff in "Split" mode is not generated by Git, but the editor itself instead so it may differ from the diff generated by Git. One advantage of this is that you can edit the text in that view.

entries.source: Disable informative notifications for git operations to minimize distraction (refer to status bar for updates).
entries.translated: Disable informative notifications for git operations to minimize distraction (refer to status bar for updates).

entries.source: Disable error notifications of any kind to minimize distraction (refer to status bar for updates).
entries.translated: Disable error notifications of any kind to minimize distraction (refer to status bar for updates).

entries.source: Don't show notifications when there are no changes to commit or push.
entries.translated: Don't show notifications when there are no changes to commit or push.

entries.source: Obsidian must be restarted for the changes to take affect.
entries.translated: Obsidian must be restarted for the changes to take affect.

entries.source: Add "Stage", "Unstage" and "Add to .gitignore" actions to the file menu.
entries.translated: Add "Stage", "Unstage" and "Add to .gitignore" actions to the file menu.

entries.source: Show the count of modified files in the status bar
entries.translated: Show the count of modified files in the status bar

entries.source: These settings usually don't need to be changed, but may be required for special setups.
entries.translated: These settings usually don't need to be changed, but may be required for special setups.

entries.source: "Commit-and-sync" and "pull" takes care of submodules. Missing features: Conflicted files, count of pulled/pushed/committed files. Tracking branch needs to be set for each submodule.
entries.translated: "Commit-and-sync" and "pull" takes care of submodules. Missing features: Conflicted files, count of pulled/pushed/committed files. Tracking branch needs to be set for each submodule.

entries.source: Use each line for a new environment variable in the format KEY=VALUE .
entries.translated: Use each line for a new environment variable in the format KEY=VALUE .

entries.source: Use each line for one path
entries.translated: Use each line for one path

entries.source: Removing previously added environment variables will not take effect until Obsidian is restarted.
entries.translated: Removing previously added environment variables will not take effect until Obsidian is restarted.

entries.source: Sets the relative path to the vault from which the Git binary should be executed. Mostly used to set the path to the Git repository, which is only required if the Git repository is below the vault root directory. Use "\" instead of "/" on Windows.
entries.translated: Sets the relative path to the vault from which the Git binary should be executed. Mostly used to set the path to the Git repository, which is only required if the Git repository is below the vault root directory. Use "\" instead of "/" on Windows.

entries.source: Requires restart of Obsidian to take effect. Use "\" instead of "/" on Windows.
entries.translated: Requires restart of Obsidian to take effect. Use "\" instead of "/" on Windows.

entries.source: Disables the plugin on this device. This setting is not synced.
entries.translated: Disables the plugin on this device. This setting is not synced.

entries.source: If you like this Plugin, consider donating to support continued development.
entries.translated: If you like this Plugin, consider donating to support continued development.

entries.source: Debugging and logging: You can always see the logs of this and every other plugin by opening the console with
entries.translated: Debugging and logging: You can always see the logs of this and every other plugin by opening the console with
